item.title: In Asia, cards account for 52% of payments, but there are new emerging payment tools
item.description:

item.title: India no longer accepts high denomination notes in the current series
item.description:
India’s Reserve Bank (RBI) has decided to discontinue the use of 500 and 1,000 rupee notes. These notes ceased to be legal tender as of November 9, 2016. Consequently, ATMs and other cash transaction machines were shut down on November 9 and 10. However, bank branches and government treasuries remained open on November 10. This move was prompted by the difficulty in differentiating real banknotes from counterfeit ones. The surge in fake currency was negatively impacting the Indian economy...

item.title: The CJEU bolsters criminal law protection of the EU's finances in The Italian Job.
item.description:
Steve Peers Contrary to popular belief, fraud against the EU budget is not typically committed by corrupt EU officials. As per EU reports, the usual culprits are individuals or companies exploiting EU funds managed by Member States. These violations also extend beyond spending to include EU income reduction, such as evading customs duties on imports. Establishing and upholding EU-wide regulations for such misconduct has been challenging.
